item.title: Managed and Unmanaged Library Interfaces with IL2CPP in Unity
item.description: The Problem with Precompiled Managed Libraries in Unity I work on an SDK that has a non-platform specific compiled managed C# library along with unmanaged C++ libaries. There are peculirarirties with iOS/tvOS/watchOS where you will want to use a static library as using a dynamic library is not officially supported by Apple like other platforms (Windows, Linux, macOS, Android). So far we’ve avoided having loose C# helper scripts alongside our managed C# dll and also we’ve avoided having different managed dlls for each platform.
